intro: Amblyanthera karwinskii, commonly known as the Karwinski's amblyanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
